data.title: build instructions aren't working for netbeans 8.0.2
data.body:
Hi,

I followed the instructions for eclipse everything worked fine. Then I tried netbeans 8.2 (under linux). I got as far as building the project using libGDX and adding the gradle project I could execute the desktop project however not the android project. I checked and seem to have added the android sdk and plugins correctly, however I notice a red line under the android imports and the message 'package android.os does not exist'

Then I get the following build failure
## Issue 1

data.title: GWT Exceptions not printing
Libgdx 1.6.0: missing newline with new text rendering
data.body:
1.6.0 behaves differently when displaying text than 1.5.6. Im not sure if this is a bug or wanted behaviour, maybe its got something to do with the changes to GlyphLayout.

Take this code:

```
GlyphLayout layout = new GlyphLayout();
FreeTypeFontGenerator generator = new FreeTypeFontGenerator(Gdx.files.internal("data/arial.ttf"));
// init font properties skipped
BitmapFont someBitmapFont = generator.generateFont(parameter);

layout.setText(someBitmapFont, "Line1\n\nLine2", Color.WHITE, screenW, Align.center, true);
someBitmapFont.draw(spriteBatch, layout, 0, screenH / 2 + layout.height / 2);
```

In 1.5.6 the string "Line1\n\nLine2" gets displayed like this:

```
Line1

Line2
```

in 1.6.0 the aditional newline is missing, it looks like this on the screen:

```
Line1
Line2
```

Not sure about the reason, maybe the empty line has a height of 0 or something like that.

data.title: Removing final Pointlight from and Environment removes DirectionalLight attribute V1.6.1 nightly
data.body:
Line 121 [Environment.java](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g3d/Environment.java)

removing the last pointlight will remove the directional light attribute. Should this be the pointlight attribute?

data.title: Setup on Windows 8 Fails
data.body:
I have the android SDK installed in the default location (if you let Android Development Studio install it) on a Windows 8 machine. This is in C:\Users\username\AppData...

When I go to browse for it, the AppData folder does not appear in the folder chooser dialogue.
If I manually type the entire path instead of browsing, it says that no SDK exists or is missing features.

data.title: Methods for scaled width and height of a sprite
data.body: After scaling sprites in my game and trying to use getWidth() and getHeight(), I wondered why they weren't accounting for scale until I looked at the javadocs. From then on I had to use getWidth() \* getScaleX() and getHeight() \* getScaleY(). I decided that it would be nice to have two methods in sprite that return the width and height accounting for scale.

data.title: BitmapFont Padding issue
data.body:
padTop, padRight, padBottom, padLeft are integers, but in setScale they are multiplied by floats. Therefore with the precision loss when by upscaling and downscaling fonts they get out of sync with the font scale itself.

This causing problems when calculating and adding xAdvances in getGlyphs() as the padding get's totally out of sync with the scale of the font.

data.title: LibGDX 1.6.0 Black screen on iOS devices.
data.body:
Tested with iPad & iOS simulator.
App that is previously working in 1.5.6 is now a black screen in 1.6.0

Running with RoboVM version 1.1.0 unfortunately RoboVM 1.2.0 is bugged and many bindings fail with it (Google analytics, InApp purchases, AdMob, list goes on).

data.title: Font wrapping error (uses wrong glyph)
When more than 3 fingers pressed simultaneously, InputProcessor work incorrectly
data.body:
On android, InputProcessor should call touchDown() three times, but instead it call touchDown() twice and touchUp() once.

On iOS, if 4 fingers pressed simultaneously, InputProcessor will cause the game to quit.

Please look into this issue.

data.title: Added distance method to MathUtils
data.body: Added a distance formula method to the MathUtils class to calculate the distance between two points.

data.title: Label's bounds works incorrect when updating to 1.5.6
Enable classpath file handle resolver to GWT backend
data.body:
Since classpath file handle are supported in GWT, I think this resolver should be enabled as well.

It is usefull when you have resources in your src folders (in my case, string localization for a library project used by other projects) and declare them through `<extend-configuration-property name="gdx.files.classpath" value=".../res/strings.properties" />` for example. Then you can use them through `ClasspathFileHandleResolver` or `Gdx.files.classpath("strings.properties")` on all backends.

data.title: [BUG] GestureDetector/GestureListener gets coordinates of the previous touch up event
data.body:
I've noticed that my game doesn't react to mouse clicks when the game window gets focus. It's because my touchUp handler receives x and y of the previous click. Since the game already performed the action in the previous location, it looks like it doesn't react. This only happens when you don't move the cursor after the window gets focus. If after the initial click (the one to bring focus to the game window) you move the cursor a bit and click again, it works fine. It just doesn't work when you switch from another app and you want to click somewhere in the game window without moving the cursor after the first click that brings focus to the game.

LibGDX - 1.5.6
OS: OS X Yosemite
JVM: 1.8.0_31
Game type: Desktop

data.title: Update project setup manager to Gradle 2.4
About TextField
data.body:
It works fine,but I found something about message text can be improved with it.
1.setAlignment(int align) does,t work when message text is visible.
2.There' no method like drawText(Batch batch, BitmapFont font, float x, float y) about drawing message text, thus if using distance field font, it's so difficult.

data.title: Jenkins Build Server.
data.body: The build status on the README.md is always "Failing". According to your Jenkins server, this is not true. I use the Jenkins plugin "embeddable-build-status" which works amazing for me. Might be worth fixing or upgrading. Also if jenkins does not build on push there is a git integration plugin that would be good too. I dont know if this is not a problem and I do not have permission to view the actuall build server or what's up.

data.title: Added Consistency.
data.body: You can see the changes I made in the request, i personally think that the method should not be called "scl" but I don't want to be repsonsible for a refactor like that. Anyways, just fixed some O.C.D things in the GitHub editor. I didn't actually change any functionality so no worries there.

data.title: More flexibility in SkinLoader
data.body: Sometimes I preload handy resources in skins so they're available to build the rest of the skin, using SkinParameter. Current implementation forces me to pass a textureAtlasPath, but I don't really need to, so these changes make possible to pass only resources in the SkinParameter.

data.title: Problem with mono samples on OSX
data.body:
I've been having issues with audio in a game I'm making. It works perfectly fine on Windows, but on OSX the audio sounded very deep and low on volume (like it was playing at 10Hz or something).

It seems that the problem is mono samples. Playing any stereo sample works fine, but converting it to a mono sample makes the problem appear again.

Let me know if you need examples, but I've tried with multiple samples from different sources with the same result.

data.title: elasticOut kinda broken
data.body:
I made a small demo to see difference between interpolations, you can see output here:
![Interpolations in action](http://i.imgur.com/iIrlat3.png)
AFAIK, interpolation's purpose is interpolating value from 0 to 1 in a fancy way. I think, it should be a rule that for every `a == 0`, interpolated value of `a` will be 0, and for every `a == 1`, interpolated value of `a` will be 1. This applies to every interpolation except elasticOut.

How to reproduce:

``` java
    System.out.println(Interpolation.elasticOut.apply(0)); //prints 1.0000001
```

data.title: On the fly texture packer
data.body:
Hi, I'm wondering if there is some kind of "on the fly" texture packer that you can use inside the app itself.

For instance, imagine you have a game set up in medieval time, and you have knights of different kingdoms. You want to create, inside the app, armored knights that combine multiple kind of helmet,  armors, some kind of iron shoes and such (and add color to a few piece). The "armor mixes" would be random, and you'd then have to create textures of the knights in different positions, pack them together before using them. And this way have a unique look for random armies, but packed and efficient.
Is it possible with libgdx?

data.title: IOSInput#getTextInput doest't implement I18N
data.body: The two buttons are named "Cancel" and "OK".

data.title: Key repeat bug in TextField and TextArea
data.body:
Key is repeated indefinitely when field loses keyboard focus while user still holds that key. Happens for every key using `keyRepeatTask` in `TextField`/`TextArea`.

Reproducing: 
1. Run `TextAreaTest`
2. Click on text area, hold left arrow.
3. Click on text field while still holding left arrow then release key.
4. Click on text area again without pressing any key, left arrow key will be repeated indefinitely.

data.title: BitmapFont.getWrapIndex doesn't handle multiple whitespace characters
Fix for issue #3080 Adds animated tile processing to TiledMapPacker
data.body: Adds AnimatedTiledMapTile processing to TiledMapPacker when using the option --strip-unused, fixes #3080.

data.title: TiledMapPacker doesn't process animated tiles with strip unused
data.body:
I am using TiledMapPacker from the latest nightly to process multiple maps using a single, very large, shared tileset that consists of several different tilesets. TiledMapPacker can only process non animated tiles, completely ignoring the frames used in an animation.
##### Expected output:

All tiles added into texture atlas, including animated tiles when using the --strip-unused option.
##### Actual output:

Animated tiles are skipped when using the --strip-unused option.
##### Things I've tried include:

not stripping unused tiles (impractical if I hope to remain under 1024x1024  or 2048x2048 sized tileset -- it's really big), and using a layer that isn't rendered to add each individual tile used in every animation e.g. a collision tile layer (impractical: tedious, waste of time, makes for unsightly layers).
##### Commands and resources used:

```
java -cp gdx.jar:gdx-natives.jar:gdx-backend-lwjgl.jar:gdx-backend-lwjgl-natives.jar:gdx-tiled-preprocessor.jar:extensions/gdx-tools/gdx-tools.jar com.badlogic.gdx.tiledmappacker.TiledMapPacker ../in/ ../out/ --strip-unused
```

Where the directory "../in/" uses gdx-tests-android's data/maps/tiled/tiles.png and a Tiled map set up for animation. [(files in "../in/")](https://github.com/oddlydrawn/libgdx-contrib/tree/master/tiledMapPacker/issueNonAnim/in) and [(files processed into "../out/")](https://github.com/oddlydrawn/libgdx-contrib/tree/master/tiledMapPacker/issueNonAnim/out) 

Note: Actually copy pasta everything into Eclipse isn't wise or advisable since you can just look at [out/map](https://github.com/oddlydrawn/libgdx-contrib/blob/master/tiledMapPacker/issueNonAnim/out/tiledPacker.tmx) and the atlas [out/tileset/packed.atlas](https://github.com/oddlydrawn/libgdx-contrib/blob/master/tiledMapPacker/issueNonAnim/out/tileset/packed.atlas) or the [tileset](https://github.com/oddlydrawn/libgdx-contrib/blob/master/tiledMapPacker/issueNonAnim/out/tileset/packed.png) to verify that the animated frames weren't processed.
##### To reproduce:

I copied the [/out/*](https://github.com/oddlydrawn/libgdx-contrib/tree/master/tiledMapPacker/issueNonAnim/out) processed atlas/map into gdx-tests-android: data/maps/tiled/ and used [Barebones.java](https://github.com/oddlydrawn/libgdx-contrib/blob/master/tiledMapPacker/issueNonAnim/Barebones.java) in gdx-tests-lwjgl. Which gives you the following exception:
##### Exception when you try to render the processed, stripped tiled map:

```
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.tiles.AnimatedTiledMapTile.getTextureRegion(AnimatedTiledMapTile.java:84)
at com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.renderers.OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer.renderTileLayer(OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer.java:102)
at com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.renderers.BatchTiledMapRenderer.render(BatchTiledMapRenderer.java:138)
at com.badlogic.gdx.tests.lwjgl.Barebones.render(Barebones.java:37)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication.mainLoop(LwjglApplication.java:215)
at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:120)
```
##### Versions of stuffs:

Tiled Map Editor: 0.11.0

libGDX: latest nightly/git

Eclipse: Luna Service Release 2 (4.4.2). 

OS: Ubuntu 14.10 Utopic x86_64
##### TL;DR

I have code that would add animated tile processing for libGDX's TiledMapPacker when you feel the need to --strip-unused.

data.title: Dynamically linked libgdx can't load libgdx64.so.
data.body:
Hi folks,

I don't know if this is a bug.

I use libgdx inside of a big maven project that compiles for pc. The project dictates me to load libgdx and its dependencies (lwjgl etc.) on runtime providing the JARs in a `/target/lib` folder and native libs in a `/target/natives` folder. My created final `visualizer.jar` includes only its own compiled classes. Everything else is added to the classpath from out `/target/lib`. I start the application via the following command on linux with various JREs:

```
cd ...../target
java -Djava.library.path=./natives -cp visualizer.jar:./lib/* org.designer.visualizer.desktop.Starter
```

IntelliJ has not problem starting the application without maven while extracting the natives to the target/classes directory.  Though, when starting via the above folder structure and the mentioned command it can't find the `libgdx64.so`.

In other words, `input` is null in `SharedLibraryLoader:125`:

```
InputStream input = SharedLibraryLoader.class.getResourceAsStream("/" + path);

Caused by: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Unable to read file for extraction: libgdx64.so
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.readFile(SharedLibraryLoader.java:126)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.loadFile(SharedLibraryLoader.java:261)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.load(SharedLibraryLoader.java:115)
```

Any advice?
